------- Additional comments from aneesh2004@dev.java.net Thu Oct 14 16:17:54
+0000 2010 ------- I have some xhtml with a body and a single div inside the body. The div has a style that uses. "position"fixed". The xhtml is ************* <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "resources/dtds/xhtml1- strict.dtd"> <html xmlns='http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml'> <head> <title></title> <meta charset='utf-8' /> </head> <body style='background-color:#000000;'> <div style='position:fixed; top:0pt; left:0pt;width:720.0pt;height:540.0pt;'> <div
When I try to load this xhtml document and create an image using from it

When I replace "position:fixed" with "position:absolute" and rerun my tests, the image is exactly the way the original xhtml shows up in browsers. So looks like positon:absolute is handled perfectly and position:fixed is missing support.
